info.author: Arne Neumann
info.description: grepurl ======= ``grepurl`` is a command line tool that extracts URLs from a website (or a local HTML file). Usage ----- :: grepurl http://example.com/ grepurl -a http://example.com/foo.htm # only extract from tags (i.e. links) grepurl -i http://example.com/bar.htm # only extract from tags (i.e. images) grepurl -r "\.py$" http://example.com/ # only extract links that end in '.py' License ------- GPLv2 or later. Authors ------- Gerome Fournier (original author). His implementation is only available via the `Internet Archive`_. Arne Neumann (added -l option for local files, minor changes). .. _`Internet Archive`: http://web.archive.org/web/20101116071317/http://jefke.free.fr/stuff/python/grepurl/grepurl
info.name: grepurl
info.summary: extract URLs from websites on the command line
info.html_description:
grepurl is a command line tool that extracts URLs from a website (or a local HTML file).

Usage

grepurl http://example.com/
grepurl -a http://example.com/foo.htm # only extract from <a> tags (i.e. links)
grepurl -i http://example.com/bar.htm # only extract from <img> tags (i.e. images)
grepurl -r "\.py$" http://example.com/ # only extract links that end in '.py'

License

GPLv2 or later.

Authors

Gerome Fournier (original author). His implementation is only available via the Internet Archive. Arne Neumann (added -l option for local files, minor changes).
